response:
## Function Analysis

### 1. Main purpose and functionality
The `wifi_setBandSteeringOverloadInactiveTime` function in the RDK `hal` sets the inactivity time in seconds for band steering under the overload condition.

### 2. Key operations and data flow
The function takes two parameters:

- `radioIndex`: The index of the radio interface to set the inactivity time for.
- `overloadInactiveTime`: The inactivity time in seconds.

The function sets the overload inactive time for band steering on the specified radio interface. When the number of associated clients on a radio exceeds the overload threshold, band steering is disabled for the specified inactivity time.

### 3. Interaction with other components (if any)
The function interacts with the band steering algorithm to disable band steering when the number of associated clients exceeds the overload threshold.

### 4. Important parameters and return values
The important parameters and return values are:

- `radioIndex`: The index of the radio interface to set the inactivity time for.
- `overloadInactiveTime`: The inactivity time in seconds after which band steering will be disabled.
- `RETURN_OK`: The function returns `RETURN_OK` if successful, or `RETURN_ERR` if an error occurs.

### 5. Any specific RDK-related operations
This function is part of the RDK Wi-Fi HAL API, which provides a standard interface for accessing Wi-Fi functionality on RDK devices.
